name: Article 56 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
text:
Name:Article 56 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The following exoneration clauses in the contract were invalid: 

(i) caused personal damage to the other party; 

(ii) caused property damage to the other party by wilful or gross negligence.

name: Article 1254 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: It is prohibited to throw objects from buildings. The infringers are liable under the law if they throw objects from buildings or cause damage from objects falling from buildings. If they fail to take the necessary security measures, they are liable under the law for failure to comply with the obligation to protect. If the circumstances set out in paragraph 1 of this article occur, the public security authorities, among others, should investigate and identify those responsible in a timely manner, in accordance with the law.
text:
Name:Article 1254 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:It is prohibited to throw objects from buildings. The infringers are liable under the law if they throw objects from buildings or cause damage from objects falling from buildings. If they fail to take the necessary security measures, they are liable under the law for failure to comply with the obligation to protect. If the circumstances set out in paragraph 1 of this article occur, the public security authorities, among others, should investigate and identify those responsible in a timely manner, in accordance with the law.

name: Article 1884 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: In the event of an offence against the property of another person, the loss of property is calculated on the basis of the market price at the time of the loss or other reasonable means.
text:
Name:Article 1884 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:In the event of an offence against the property of another person, the loss of property is calculated on the basis of the market price at the time of the loss or other reasonable means.

name: Article 934 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: In the case of death, termination or death, loss of civil capacity or termination of the trust, the contract of trust is terminated, unless otherwise agreed by the parties or is not suitable for termination depending on the nature of the trust.
text:
Name:Article 934 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:In the case of death, termination or death, loss of civil capacity or termination of the trust, the contract of trust is terminated, unless otherwise agreed by the parties or is not suitable for termination depending on the nature of the trust.

name: Article 1,255 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: If the pile collapses, rolls or slides, causing damage to others, the piler cannot prove that he or she has no fault, he or she should be held responsible for the tort.
text:
Name:Article 1,255 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:If the pile collapses, rolls or slides, causing damage to others, the piler cannot prove that he or she has no fault, he or she should be held responsible for the tort.

name: Article 477 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The intention to withdraw an offer means that it is made in the form of a dialogue, the content of which should be known to the offeree before the offeree makes a commitment; the intention to withdraw an offer means that it is made in a non-dialogue manner and should reach the offeree before the offeree makes a commitment.
text:
Name:Article 477 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The intention to withdraw an offer means that it is made in the form of a dialogue, the content of which should be known to the offeree before the offeree makes a commitment; the intention to withdraw an offer means that it is made in a non-dialogue manner and should reach the offeree before the offeree makes a commitment.

name: Article 608 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: If the seller, by agreement or pursuant to article 6, paragraph 2 (b), of this Law, places the subject matter at the place of delivery, if the buyer fails to collect it in breach of the agreement, the risk of damage or loss to the subject matter will be borne by the buyer from the time of the breach.
text:
Name:Article 608 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:If the seller, by agreement or pursuant to article 6, paragraph 2 (b), of this Law, places the subject matter at the place of delivery, if the buyer fails to collect it in breach of the agreement, the risk of damage or loss to the subject matter will be borne by the buyer from the time of the breach.

name: Article 583 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: If one of the parties fails to perform its contractual obligations or the performance of its contractual obligations is not in conformity with the agreement, the other party shall be compensated for any other loss after performance or remedial action has been taken.
text:
Name:Article 583 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:If one of the parties fails to perform its contractual obligations or the performance of its contractual obligations is not in conformity with the agreement, the other party shall be compensated for any other loss after performance or remedial action has been taken.

name: Article 931 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The trustee may, with the consent of the trustee, entrust the commissioning to a third person other than the trustee. If, therefore, there is a loss to the trustee, the trustee may apply to the trustee for compensation for the loss.
text:
Name:Article 931 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The trustee may, with the consent of the trustee, entrust the commissioning to a third person other than the trustee. If, therefore, there is a loss to the trustee, the trustee may apply to the trustee for compensation for the loss.

name: Article 61 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The seller shall deliver the subject matter at the agreed time. If the time of delivery is agreed, the seller may deliver at any time within that time.
text:
Name:Article 61 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The seller shall deliver the subject matter at the agreed time. If the time of delivery is agreed, the seller may deliver at any time within that time.

name: Article 527 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The party who has to perform the obligation first has precise evidence that the performance may be suspended if: n(i) there is a serious deterioration in the performance of the business; n(ii) transfers of property and flight of funds in order to avoid the debt; n(iii) loss of commercial reputation; n(iv) other circumstances of loss or potential loss of ability to perform. \n\n If the parties have no precise evidence to suspend performance, they shall be liable for default.
text:
Name:Article 527 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The party who has to perform the obligation first has precise evidence that the performance may be suspended if: n(i) there is a serious deterioration in the performance of the business; n(ii) transfers of property and flight of funds in order to avoid the debt; n(iii) loss of commercial reputation; n(iv) other circumstances of loss or potential loss of ability to perform. \n\n If the parties have no precise evidence to suspend performance, they shall be liable for default.

name: Article 25 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The domicile of a natural person, which is registered on the basis of a civil registry or other valid identity, is the place of residence; if the habitual residence is not in conformity with the domicile, the habitual residence is considered to be the domicile.
text:
Name:Article 25 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The domicile of a natural person, which is registered on the basis of a civil registry or other valid identity, is the place of residence; if the habitual residence is not in conformity with the domicile, the habitual residence is considered to be the domicile.

name: Article 41 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: Prior to the expiration of the period for performance of the obligation, the mortgager agrees with the mortgager that the encumbered property is owned by the creditor at the time the debtor fails to perform the mature debt and can only be paid in priority in accordance with the law.
text:
Name:Article 41 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:Prior to the expiration of the period for performance of the obligation, the mortgager agrees with the mortgager that the encumbered property is owned by the creditor at the time the debtor fails to perform the mature debt and can only be paid in priority in accordance with the law.

name: Article 950 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: Upon termination of the property service contract, the former property service provider shall continue to deal with property services matters and may request the owner to pay for property expenses for the period until the owner or the new property service person selected by the owner ' s assembly or the owner who decides to manage it has taken over.
text:
Name:Article 950 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:Upon termination of the property service contract, the former property service provider shall continue to deal with property services matters and may request the owner to pay for property expenses for the period until the owner or the new property service person selected by the owner ' s assembly or the owner who decides to manage it has taken over.

name: Article 1884 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The relationship between the parents and their children is not dissolved by divorce. After divorce, the child, whether directly raised by the father or mother, remains a child of both parents. After divorce, the parents still have the right and duty to support, educate, and protect the child.
text:
Name:Article 1884 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The relationship between the parents and their children is not dissolved by divorce. After divorce, the child, whether directly raised by the father or mother, remains a child of both parents. After divorce, the parents still have the right and duty to support, educate, and protect the child.

name: Article 343 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: Where State-owned agricultural land is contracted, reference is made to the relevant provisions of this Part.
text:
Name:Article 343 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:Where State-owned agricultural land is contracted, reference is made to the relevant provisions of this Part.

name: Article 901 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: If the depositary holds the currency, it may return the same type and quantity of currency; if it holds other alternatives, it may return the same type, quality and quantity of goods as agreed.
text:
Name:Article 901 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:If the depositary holds the currency, it may return the same type and quantity of currency; if it holds other alternatives, it may return the same type, quality and quantity of goods as agreed.

name: Article 73 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: At the end of the lease term, the lessee shall return the lease. The lease returned shall be in accordance with its agreed or post-use status, depending on the nature of the lease.
text:
Name:Article 73 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:At the end of the lease term, the lessee shall return the lease. The lease returned shall be in accordance with its agreed or post-use status, depending on the nature of the lease.

name: Article 12,119 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: Medical personnel shall inform the patient of their condition and of the medical measures taken in the course of their consultations. If there is a need for surgery, special examinations, and special treatment, medical personnel shall promptly specify to the patient the medical risks, alternative medical programmes, etc., and obtain their express consent; if they cannot or are not appropriate to the patient, they shall inform the patients close relatives and obtain their express consent.
text:
Name:Article 12,119 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:Medical personnel shall inform the patient of their condition and of the medical measures taken in the course of their consultations. If there is a need for surgery, special examinations, and special treatment, medical personnel shall promptly specify to the patient the medical risks, alternative medical programmes, etc., and obtain their express consent; if they cannot or are not appropriate to the patient, they shall inform the patients close relatives and obtain their express consent.

name: Article 1230 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: In the event of a dispute over the pollution of the environment or the destruction of the ecology, the perpetrator shall bear the burden of proof for the absence of liability under the law or for the mitigating circumstances and the absence of a causal link between the act and the damage.
text:
Name:Article 1230 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:In the event of a dispute over the pollution of the environment or the destruction of the ecology, the perpetrator shall bear the burden of proof for the absence of liability under the law or for the mitigating circumstances and the absence of a causal link between the act and the damage.

name: Article 317 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: When the entitled person receives the lost goods, he or she shall pay the necessary expenses to the pick-up person or the relevant authority for the maintenance of the lost goods.
text:
Name:Article 317 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:When the entitled person receives the lost goods, he or she shall pay the necessary expenses to the pick-up person or the relevant authority for the maintenance of the lost goods.

name: Article 960 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: It is not provided for in this chapter and refers to the relevant provisions of the trust contract to which they apply.
text:
Name:Article 960 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:It is not provided for in this chapter and refers to the relevant provisions of the trust contract to which they apply.

name: Article 182 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: In the event of damage caused by an emergency avoidance, the person who caused the risk incurs civil liability. (n) If the risk arises out of natural causes, the person who causes the emergency avoidance does not incur civil liability, appropriate compensation may be awarded. (n) If the emergency avoidance measures are inappropriate or exceed the limits necessary to cause undue damage, the emergency evader shall bear appropriate civil liability.)
text:
Name:Article 182 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:In the event of damage caused by an emergency avoidance, the person who caused the risk incurs civil liability. (n) If the risk arises out of natural causes, the person who causes the emergency avoidance does not incur civil liability, appropriate compensation may be awarded. (n) If the emergency avoidance measures are inappropriate or exceed the limits necessary to cause undue damage, the emergency evader shall bear appropriate civil liability.)

name: Article 852 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The contractor entrusted with the development contract shall, as agreed, pay research and development funds and remuneration, provide technical information, submit research and development requirements, complete collaborative matters and receive research and development results.
text:
Name:Article 852 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The contractor entrusted with the development contract shall, as agreed, pay research and development funds and remuneration, provide technical information, submit research and development requirements, complete collaborative matters and receive research and development results.

name: Article 656 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The contract for the supply of water, gas and heat for use is governed by the relevant provisions of the contract for the supply of electricity.
text:
Name:Article 656 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The contract for the supply of water, gas and heat for use is governed by the relevant provisions of the contract for the supply of electricity.

name: Article 231 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: Where property rights have been established or extinguished as a result of de facto acts such as lawful construction or demolition of houses, they are effective from the moment of their accomplishment.
text:
Name:Article 231 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:Where property rights have been established or extinguished as a result of de facto acts such as lawful construction or demolition of houses, they are effective from the moment of their accomplishment.

name: Article 74 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: A legal person may establish branches in accordance with the law. The law and administrative regulations stipulate that branches shall be registered in accordance with their provisions.
text:
Name:Article 74 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:A legal person may establish branches in accordance with the law. The law and administrative regulations stipulate that branches shall be registered in accordance with their provisions.

name: Article 216 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The real estate register is the basis for the ownership and content of property rights.
text:
Name:Article 216 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The real estate register is the basis for the ownership and content of property rights.

name: Article 190 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The statute of limitations period for persons without civil capacity or for persons with civil capacity limiting the right of petition of their legal representative is calculated from the date on which the legal representative ceases to exist.
text:
Name:Article 190 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The statute of limitations period for persons without civil capacity or for persons with civil capacity limiting the right of petition of their legal representative is calculated from the date on which the legal representative ceases to exist.

name: Article 305 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The other co-owners have the right to preferential purchase under the same conditions.
text:
Name:Article 305 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The other co-owners have the right to preferential purchase under the same conditions.

name: Article 573 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: When the subject matter is saved, the risk of damage or loss is borne by the creditor. During the deposit, the fruits of the subject matter are owned by the creditor.
text:
Name:Article 573 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:When the subject matter is saved, the risk of damage or loss is borne by the creditor. During the deposit, the fruits of the subject matter are owned by the creditor.

name: Article 664 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
content: The heirs or legal representatives of the grantor may withdraw the gift because of the death or loss of civil capacity as a result of an offence committed by the grantee.
text:
Name:Article 664 of the Civil Code of the People ' s Republic of China
Content:The heirs or legal representatives of the grantor may withdraw the gift because of the death or loss of civil capacity as a result of an offence committed by the grantee.
